description.p: The Qunari are a towering, muscular race known for their strength, resilience, and unwavering discipline. Their culture follows the rigid and structured Qun, which governs their society with strict rules. Qunari are formidable fighters, with an intimidating presence and resistance to poison. Though powerful, they are wary of magic, particularly spells involving Charisma, which they view as a threat to their order.
Your qunari character has a variety of natural abilities, the result of thousands of years of refinement.
Ability Score Increase. Your Strength score increases by 2 and Constitution by 1.
Age. You live slightly longer than humans due to your natural constitution and advanced medicine your people live well into their 90 - 100's
Alignment.Most Qunari adhere to a lawful or neutral alignment, dedicated to following the Qun's strict code of behavior, but some can deviate, especially those who stray from their upbringing.
Size.Qunari are generally taller and more muscular than humans, standing between 6 and 8 feet tall. Your size is Medium.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Magic WeaknessYou have disadvantage on charisma saving throws against spells and magical effects. Your connection to magic is strained, particularly with the manipulation of emotions, willpower, and charm.
Poison ResistanceYou have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance to poison damage.

Imtimidating PresenseYou are proficient in the Intimidation skill. Your imposing physical presence and unyielding discipline make you a fearsome figure. You may use your strength instead of charisma when intimidating someone.

Qunari ResilienceAs a reaction, when you take physical damage (piercing, slashing or bludgeoning), you can reduce the damage by an amount equal to 1d12 + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses of this feature after finishing a long rest.
Languages As a qunari you can speak and read Qunlat.
You have disadvantage on charisma saving throws against spells and magical effects. Your connection to magic is strained, particularly with the manipulation of emotions, willpower, and charm.
